org.usfirst.frc.team1891.drivesystem

Class MotorAndSide

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1891.drivesystem.MotorAndSide

  • public class MotorAndSide
extends java.lang.Object
    This is used as a support class for the drive system constructor. To properly use the Drive system controller create a list of all motors used in the drive system, using this class. Then use that list for the constructor.
    Author:
    Tyler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MotorAndSide(Jaguar jag, java.lang.String side)
      Constructor for MotorAndSide, instatiates the motor with the information about what side of the robot it is on.
      MotorAndSide(TalonSRX talon, java.lang.String side)
      Constructor for MotorAndSide, instatiates the motor with the information about what side of the robot it is on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MotorAndSide

        public MotorAndSide(Jaguar jag,
                    java.lang.String side)
             throws InvalidSideException
        Constructor for MotorAndSide, instatiates the motor with the information about what side of the robot it is on. Use this constructor if the drive system consists of jag motors.
        Parameters:
        jag - the jag object
        side - of the robot the jag is on. value of side should either be "RIGHT" or "LEFT" else an error will be thrown.
        Throws:
        InvalidSideException - thrown when the side of the motor is invalid.

      • MotorAndSide

        public MotorAndSide(TalonSRX talon,
                    java.lang.String side)
             throws InvalidSideException
        Constructor for MotorAndSide, instatiates the motor with the information about what side of the robot it is on. Use this constructor if the drive system consists of TalonSRX motors.
        Parameters:
        talon - the TalonSRX motor object
        side - side of the robot the TalonSRX is on. value of side should either be "RIGHT" or "LEFT" else an error will be thrown.
        Throws:
        InvalidSideException - thrown when the side of the motor is invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • getJag

        public Jaguar getJag()
        Returns:
        returns the current jag object, will return null if jag motors are not being used.

      • getTalonSRX

        public TalonSRX getTalonSRX()
        Returns:
        returns the current talonSRX object, will return null if srx motors are not being used.

      • getSide

        public java.lang.String getSide()
        Returns:
        the side that the motor is on.
